Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Okay, lets tackle this problem step by step. First, I need to understand the requirements for both the normative rules and the desiderata. The normative rules are strict, so any violation there is a problem. The desiderata are more about best practices but not mandatory. Starting with Part 1: Normative Process Behavior. The key constraints are the sequence of activities. The correct order is Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant if Approved then Finalize Documentation Close Case. Also, if rejected, no finalizing documentation before closing.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the event logs: Case 1: The sequence seems correct. Application received, then credit check, risk assessment, loan decision (approved), inform applicant, finalize documentation, close case. All steps are in order. No issues here. So Case 1 is compliant with normative rules.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2: Application received, then Risk Assessment is done before Credit Check. Thats a violation of the sequence rule because Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment. Then later, Credit Check is done, but after Risk Assessment. But the normative rule says Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment. So this is a clear violation. Also, after the loan decision (rejected), they did Finalize Documentation, which is not allowed if rejected. So Case 2 has two normative violations: wrong order of Credit Check and Risk Assessment, and finalizing documentation after rejection.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3: Application received on 2024-01-12, Credit Check on 2024-01-14, which is more than 24 hours later. Thats a desideratum violation (timing recommendation), not a normative one. Then, the Loan Decision is on 2024-01-14, and Inform Applicant is on 2024-01-16, which is more than 48 hours after the decision. Thats another desideratum violation. Also, theres no Follow-up Call, which is a desideratum. But all normative steps are followed: Credit Check before Risk Assessment, then Risk Assessment before Loan Decision, etc. So Case 3 is compliant with normative rules but has desideratum issues.

Name: Validation - IND
Text: Now, for the desiderata: Case 2: The Credit Check was done after Risk Assessment, which is a normative violation, but the desideratum about timing isnt mentioned here. Wait, the desiderata include timing for Credit Check (within 24 hours) and informing the applicant (within 48 hours of decision). Case 2s Application Received is 2024-01-11 08:00, Credit Check is done at 08:20, which is within 24 hours. Wait, no, the problem in Case 2 is that the Credit Check was done after Risk Assessment. Wait, no, the event log for Case 2 says: Case 2: 2024-01-11 08:00: Application Received 2024-01-11 08:20: Risk Assessment (which is wrong because Credit Check should be before) Then 2024-01-11 09:00: Credit Check (so after Risk Assessment) Then Loan Decision (Rejected), then Finalize Documentation, then Close Case. So the Credit Check was done after the Risk Assessment. So thats a normative violation. The timing of Credit Check in Case 2: Application was received at 08:00, Credit Check at 09:00. Thats within 24 hours, so the desideratum is met. But the order is wrong. So for desiderata, Case 2s Credit Check is okay in timing, but the order is wrong. However, the desiderata arent about order, only timing and follow-up.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3: The Credit Check was done on 2024-01-14 10:00, which is 2 days after Application Received on 2024-01-12. Thats more than 24 hours, so thats a desideratum violation. Then, the Inform Applicant is on 2024-01-16 15:00, which is 2 days after the Loan Decision (2024-01-14 12:00). Thats 48 hours and 3 hours later, which is over the recommended 48 hours. So thats another desideratum violation. Also, no Follow-up Call. So Case 3 has three desideratum issues.
